title: Grade 12 - Personal Life Management, Open HIP4O (2013)
subject: Social Science and Humanities

document.title: Grade 12 - Personal Life Management, Open HIP4O (2013)

8CCD4E6620094C88A90396F94581C9A8.description: identify the additional financial arrangements workers in alternative employment need to make (e.g., planning for retirement; purchasing injury, accident, and supplementary health insurance; saving for income tax)

2E3EA0C676044620A948060CC596DFE7.description: describe various alternatives to regular full-time employment (e.g., self-employment, contract work, part-time work, job sharing, multiple jobs)

12668F0E6FCC491AA9A4CF9C8302F428.description: identify the types of benefits employers might offer as part of a job contract (e.g., supplementary health insurance, life insurance, pension, paid vacation, sick leave, skills-upgrading programs)

E4BD5560899A4BE3823E7029D46570BB.description: explain the typical deductions from a pay-cheque (e.g., union dues, income tax, employment insurance, private pension, Canada Pension Plan)

5360E3FFE72A42ECB57AC23CC7CB9A3C.description: explain the benefits of working for pay (e.g., opportunities to: make a living; develop relationships/networks; strengthen interpersonal skills; increase competencies; obtain personal gratification and/or satisfaction through making a contribution; offset feelings of boredom; expand professional skills, knowledge, and experience)

7F928EABC68447DD99BD96C702327C2C.description: identify the economic and personal costs associated with working for pay (e.g., cost of clothing and uniforms, safety equipment, tools, transportation, food, childcare; job-related stress or illness; limited time to meet personal needs)

2E547441B2A1483C982C0F01E9D3B511.description: Benefits and Costs of Working: explain the benefits and costs of working.

7A7B87F46C504AC283CB12C9F1BF8083.description: compare the products and services offered by a variety of financial institutions (e.g., debit cards, credit cards, lines of credit, loans, mortgages, investment instruments, automatic teller machines, financial advisers)

8C25C6FCD94E4EDFAF96977C22F77397.description: identify various types of financial institutions in the community (e.g., banks, credit unions, finance companies, trust companies, the stock market)

6F4509ADAA694779B1E8043B70705EAC.description: Financial Institutions: describe ways in which financial institutions can assist in the management of personal finances;

86D290BE41E143079EFC9FF4FA712799.description: identify and describe strategies they can use to plan for and manage unexpected financial crises (e.g., saving money, making investments, owning property, borrowing money, using credit, preventing and/or repairing the damage from identity theft and fraud)

8132BF309EC747E0AA7BECF15CAE875F.description: analyse the impact of employment changes on personal finances (e.g., layoffs, long strikes, downsizing, plant closures, promotions)

6F1389EEA0F1432DA21E483A60A13802.description: explain the impact of various economic changes on individual finances (e.g., changes in interest rates, consumer prices, employment rates; fluctuations in the value of the dollar; inflation; border closures; changes in the supply of or demand for various commodities)

897FD942F18C461C9B671746151C131D.description: Economic Influences: demonstrate an understanding of how global, national, and community economic factors affect the individual's financial circumstances;

7FA2C9BE84024FDDA3FDC49D5CAC0DB0.description: demonstrate the use of effective techniques for making consumer complaints (e.g., writing letters of complaint; contacting a customer-relations department, the ombudsman, or the Better Business Bureau; reporting to appropriate authorities)

83ADB0076AC443388680B64E9613397B.description: evaluate retail shopping opportunities available within their community as sources of basic products and services (e.g., catalogue shopping, retail stores, convenience stores, outlet malls, home shopping channels on television, Internet shopping, buying clubs, bulk warehouse purchasing, farmers' markets)

7A241B22740B40F78F297CCB6B1E2298.description: identify the basic products and services needed to support independent living (e.g., furnishings, utility services, communication services, staple goods, household equipment, consumable goods, insurance)

494501337F68438E8096EFBAF0E50987.description: identify internal and external factors that influence spending decisions (e.g., personal preferences, convenience, cultural values, status-related motives, advertising, product cost and availability, environmental impact, considerations related to labour and exploitation issues)

1ECB4F85D3434E509EFD743DB394263B.description: describe strategies for making responsible consumer decisions when living independently (e.g., prioritizing needs and wants, comparison shopping, reading warranties and contracts, considering the environmental impact of purchases, reading information labels)

5C436FB9DF564F84B0C5465B46ACA612.description: Consumer Rights and Responsibilities: demonstrate an understanding of the role that responsible consumerism plays in living independently.

EBDBA7865E5940DEA4F6BD435E4F918A.description: explain the benefits of taking training in preventing and/or addressing harassment and violence in the workplace

934E38454DFD4FF28361A96318E0CB0F.description: describe key provisions of legislation that governs labour relations and unions in the workplace (e.g., the Employment Standards Act, the Ontario Human Rights Code)

1D86259ACCE2448EB8D7B502A49BE28B.description: identify policies, laws, and government regulations related to health and safety in the workplace (e.g., employee manuals, workplace safety policies, the Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System, the Ontario Occupational Health and Safety Act)

7FAF0DE1CAB64814ACB3CDE564234BFA.description: identify the rights and responsibilities of employees and employers

7EFFB65C8D1E4D3399CC2B9D36A5B42B.description: explain the importance of ethics and honesty in the workplace

E19C1B27C7D6461895C9E52469344166.description: explain the importance of maintaining a positive attitude and self-image in the workplace

582A60C83FD84D4AA69C1A41CC4CC598.description: Workplace Rights and Responsibilities: demonstrate an understanding of the rights and responsibilities of employers and employees, including both personal and legal responsibilities;

57DB8DD79719482E93B6DCC5DE2EDFA6.description: identify strategies for maintaining a healthy balance between work and personal life (e.g., managing stress, prioritizing activities, making time for self and family, being physically active, getting enough sleep, maintaining healthy relationships, contributing to the community)

F4ADCD8CC2E041D1AE07EE80A53AA988.description: identify personally relevant legal documents, records, and areas of law (e.g., insurance policies, wills, leases, health records, insurance records, the Landlord and Tenant Act, municipal by-laws), and describe their importance

7D6830E58CAE43709075518D7E321D02.description: explain the various ways individuals meet their basic housing needs (e.g., choosing appropriate housing alternatives, budgeting for shelter, maintaining a safe and clean home, contacting community organizations that provide assistance)

ADA82E29E7304DB4856868A6A0379479.description: explain the various ways individuals meet their basic clothing needs (e.g., wardrobe planning, laundering clothing, contacting community organizations that provide assistance, shopping at used-clothing stores)

D3BB8D9C2E32491581B5B4E9E026760B.description: describe the various ways individuals meet their basic food needs (e.g., budgeting for food, making healthy food choices, planning meals, buying locally produced food, applying food safety techniques, recognizing the importance of breakfast, contacting community organizations that provide assistance)

174C820E1ECC44279FE6BF31D5FED5C4.description: Personal Responsibilities: demonstrate an understanding of the role of personal responsibility in independent living, and of strategies that can be used to meet individual needs;

8E6378FDDEEA4AD592D1EFA137419410.description: demonstrate the skills required to plan and safely prepare healthy meals (e.g., budgeting for food, shopping for groceries, using Nutrition Facts tables and food labels to make healthy food choices, preparing nutritious meals, using small appliances appropriately, practising food and kitchen safety)

ED4D574A7A8044CA8439756F074CD393.description: demonstrate the skills required to acquire and maintain a functional personal wardrobe (e.g., budgeting for purchases, caring for clothing, altering and repairing clothing)

5F7F4D6990974C0BA9BFA69DEFF8CCBF.description: describe the basic responsibilities involved in maintaining a safe and functional home environment (e.g., conserving water and energy, recycling, reducing waste, making informed decisions about the use of toxic household products, making minor home repairs, storing flammable liquids safely, ensuring that smoke detectors and fire extinguishers are in working order, planning escape routes)

2AB84FFD831641F5953B2247FCBC9417.description: describe the basic components of a home environment that is safe and adequate for their needs

ECEC4DDAE9904A59927E2D18D56595EB.description: Managing a Household: describe and demonstrate the use of basic principles and techniques of effective household management.

7CBBECCAA9094B2797F4FBC2B49D1126.description: explain the advantages and disadvantages of buying on credit (e.g., commitment of future income; positive and negative effects on credit rating; risks of repossession, garnishment of wages, or bankruptcy; purchase protection)

595B694F1918489AB282C09A8FF17CAF.description: demonstrate the use of strategies for effectively managing finances and planning next steps if they are unable to earn sufficient income to support themselves and/or their families

E54539F39D4E4FCFBFD5DF2F90E1AA89.description: explain the reasons for setting aside a portion of income as savings (e.g., to prepare for emergencies, to plan for future purchases, to maintain their home, to save for education or retirement)

87C2FE7126C046108255E7BACB2E3DBD.description: demonstrate the use of effective money-management strategies (e.g., budgeting, banking, responsible credit card use, bank statement reconciliation)

75BCE316D3FF40E082624FAD567B8685.description: explain factors that affect the use of money as a resource (e.g., basic needs, personal needs, wants, goals, priorities)

6CBD9D975ADB4965A46FECAC000E6820.description: Managing Financial Resources: explain and demonstrate the use of basic money-management skills and techniques needed to manage personal financial resources effectively;

9FE5C79A89774AEBB8790338CE9427A0.description: analyse the relationship between effective decision making and personal well-being

AC1BE91BB06C4D6B8B236A719538F02D.description: explain how a variety of factors (e.g., resources; personal, family, and community values; individual goals, abilities, and interests) can influence an individual's decision-making process

630F41AFF3CA4E879DBCF081944372C1.description: identify an appropriate decision-making model, use it to make a particular personal choice, and evaluate its effectiveness

2E78459CBC4F47669E8D48DE95FAB7CD.description: evaluate the effectiveness of some common approaches to decision making (e.g., acting on impulse, adopting a laissez-faire attitude, flipping a coin, setting priorities, weighing alternatives)

247F2A384AED4B5DA9049280EDC16D3F.description: Making Decisions: demonstrate an understanding of effective decision-making processes and their role in independent living;

90598E97AF1C42F289FAA2009B9B4B19.description: apply appropriate conflict-resolution skills to resolve interpersonal conflicts

94343FC20C1D4351A5B01288CD0E9725.description: determine which models of conflict resolution (e.g., acquiescence, mediation, compromise, collaboration, synthesis) are most appropriate for resolving different types of conflicts

12472D14648247C5A0084E11E4F38243.description: identify common causes of conflict in interpersonal relationships (e.g., power inequalities, power struggles, gossip, rumours, differing opinions or values, feelings of disrespect)

FCCB478827F64C44AC5D6291F27D842B.description: explain how cultural awareness and understanding can assist communication

1EEEE4B26EF749A28AA50A273E8BC4BE.description: describe techniques for communicating effectively (e.g., listening actively, using "I" messages, maintaining open body language, maintaining a positive attitude, choosing an appropriate level of assertiveness, acknowledging the perspective of the other person)

150F64A903804B89B11C0308FAE3CF18.description: describe barriers to effective communication (e.g., noise, misinterpretations, interruptions, distractions, interference, bias, stereotyping)

798F08F846F849D28E5DC04A6A9E1918.description: describe different styles of communication (e.g., passive, aggressive, passive aggressive, assertive), and identify their strengths and weaknesses

1C2E3088562149C9B784BCAE63236CB6.description: identify the components of verbal and non-verbal communication (e.g., choice of vocabulary and level of language, tone of voice, body language and manner of self-presentation, physical distance, appropriate physical contact, choice and use of written/electronic media)

310F4E7D795C48918A10727FCFEA2FBA.description: Communicating Effectively: demonstrate an understanding of effective communication skills and their role in building the healthy relationships that support independent living.

0A9D209A5F7747E49B7A6CA24A846728.description: summarize the steps required for obtaining desirable employment (e.g., recording their own work experience to build a portfolio/résumé; identifying skills, interests, and educational achievements; preparing or revising a résumé and letter of application; collecting references)

4A4F2B6CC8724DAF95A68090528553E0.description: identify occupations available in fields related to their personal skills, interests, values, and attributes

931C0D7AD42D40198FF47E72D8AA3106.description: Planning for Employment: describe the elements of successful planning for employment;

5D157598DE6E4A1B9401C5FB4D556D4B.description: explain the importance of building a network of human resources to support independent living (e.g., friends, mentors, community organizations)

4FC85FAF824E4CC389204053B6DAB3B0.description: explain how pursuing opportunities for ongoing learning (e.g., taking additional courses such as First Aid, CPR, computer applications) can help them achieve their personal goals and contribute to future success

4AC14A8D424B424185093CF54F32AF47.description: explain the importance of initiative, persistence, and motivation in achieving personal goals

AD7D815DE6AA4D24B9F6A1DA6EA4AC7C.description: identify their personal short-term and long-term goals and the essential skills and knowledge needed to achieve them

EE115E5AAEF64218A461EE3AE9B0CF7E.description: compare the roles of adolescents and adults, and identify responsibilities they themselves will assume and personal qualities they will require as they take on adult roles

FF7548E9D98C4DC2B2CFE98F6717D32B.description: Progressing From Adolescence to Adulthood: demonstrate an understanding of the personal qualities and skills necessary to make the transition from adolescence to adulthood;

7AC018BE279D451DB314975631DFF209.description: demonstrate an understanding of the general research process by reflecting on and evaluating their own research, inquiry, and communication skills

A485BE1428AE48BD894ADEFB6E14CD62.description: clearly communicate the results of their inquiries (e.g., write clearly, organize ideas logically, use language conventions properly), and follow APA conventions for acknowledging sources (e.g., generate a reference list in APA style)

0270D2F5B02C49848220B4F1555C1EE3.description: use terms relating to personal life management correctly (e.g., resources, budgeting, goal setting, consumerism)

6740DF818E0747FDA20D96BE6830826B.description: use an appropriate format (e.g., oral presentation, podcast, brochure, poster, report, multimedia presentation, web page) to communicate the results of their research and inquiry effectively for a specific purpose and audience

6CED41ACBADC401BB046FE2C7DF3F07F.description: Communicating and Reflecting: communicate the results of their research and inquiry clearly and effectively, and reflect on and evaluate their research, inquiry, and communication skills.

9F67C1F75602465983958016C4189D65.description: synthesize findings and formulate conclusions (e.g., weigh and connect information to determine the answer to their research question)

0F669FCCE77B4DDFBDFEC29F1B3367CB.description: demonstrate academic honesty by documenting the sources of all information generated through research

BF7F571E8D9C49CCB61099D7E8B9606C.description: analyse and interpret research information (e.g., compare results of surveys and interviews; determine whether common themes arise in different sources)

0E3B1EA00FB148F5959C74A8B72679AA.description: record and organize information and key ideas using a variety of formats (e.g., notes, graphic organizers, summaries, audio/digital records)

3FF4A06AD2BF4A6E927E9E678C15B19A.description: assess various aspects of information gathered from a variety of primary and secondary sources (e.g., accuracy, relevance, reliability, inherent values and bias, voice)

4C7D71674B084E5B8A594BF587E5E4A0.description: Processing Information: assess, record, analyse, and synthesize information gathered through research and inquiry;

DE301B24D60A42199C1C604528D76D46.description: based on preliminary research, for each investigation formulate a hypothesis, thesis statement, or research question, and use it to focus their research

E76D536205DE4BA4BDB9CBDCFD20341E.description: locate and select information relevant to their investigations from a variety of primary sources (e.g., interviews, observations, surveys, questionnaires, original documents in print and other media – film, photographs, songs, advertisements) and/or secondary sources (e.g., textbooks, newspaper or magazine articles, book reviews, research reports, websites, brochures)

8DA4FF838D09404D8A090A205C3B5DF7.description: create appropriate research plans to investigate their selected topics (e.g., outline purpose and method; identify sources of information), ensuring that their plans follow guidelines for ethical research

0E4DE771E0164F1EA49C10096E1DD924.description: Investigating: create research plans, and locate and select information relevant to their chosen topics, using appropriate social science research and inquiry methods;

25A18CBFD7DC41F295F0BA861E2686A0.description: formulate effective questions to guide their research and inquiry

8A1B7F11E1AE48CDB7CF0E2C178F2B18.description: identify key concepts (e.g., through discussion, brainstorming, use of visual organizers) related to their selected topics

00AA2B161A6D4EF79C78D64121E87D6F.description: explore a variety of topics related to personal life management (e.g., careers, consumer rights, rights of employees and employers, economic trends, investment options, credit-card options, financial services) to identify topics for research and inquiry

0968EC277D184E2AAF9EBD27CB0AA7E1.description: Exploring: explore topics related to personal life management, and formulate questions to guide their research;
